p: HuCoV strains 229E and OC43 cause one-third of common colds and hospital-acquired upper respiratory tract HuCoV infections, and survive in saline solution for 6 d[ 27]. It is reported that there was an < 1 log 10 infectivity decrease for both TGEV and MHV at 4 °C after 4 wk[ 36]. At 4 °C, the time required to achieve a 4 log 10 reduction in infectivity titer in pasteurized settled sewage was 98 d for TGEV vs 139 d for MHV, and the predicted time for an 4 log 10 infectivity reduction of both TGEV and MHV in reagent-grade water was approximately one year[ 36].
